page.title: 15FARMING IN WORCESTERSHIRE
page.content:
{Oh, the joys of farming!}The land is a medium heavy clay and only selected areas are suitable for crops - mainly cereals, barley, and wheat, with an even smaller area for market gardening. The predominant cover is grassland, supporting cattle and sheep. There is only limited dairy farming. Fields are small, boundaries are high and unfriendly hawthorn.
The farm buildings are well maintained - substantial but not historic in themselves. One of the more interesting is the one recently managed 'separately' from the{old} {Manor House at Dovedale.}Woodland - often oak and other hardwood - is not extensive, and is mainly as small copses or field boundaries.
